metadata.title: CVE-2023-36054 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: lib/kadm5/kadm_rpc_xdr.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.20.2 and1.21.x before 1.21.1 frees an uninitialized pointer. A remote authenticateduser can trigger a kadmind crash. This occurs because_xdr_kadm5_principal_ent_rec does not validate the relationship betweenn_key_data and the key_data array count.

criterions.comment: krb5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
